intro: Wurmbea bullata, commonly known as the yellow rain lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots and strap-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow, bell-shaped flowers during the rainy season. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural purposes.
